answers.answer: I had the same experience when I was 34 weeks pregnant with my baby, also had some leg pains. Not to scare you or anything, but I had Pre-eclampsy and I had an emergency C-section.  You should consult your doctor, because if this is your case they need to treat that a.s.a.p.I hope evrything goes perfect for you...God Bless you and your baby!
I would tell your doctor about this. It can mean preeclampsia, or high blood pressure. Something you should get checked for. Do you have much swelling?
is it followed with a headache? sometimes that is a sign of a migrain. or your blood sugar could be low..or your blood pressure..
I was thinking preaclampsia, I had it with my second pg but not my third so I thought I was in the clear, I'll call my doc, this may mean spoiling library plans for my kids again!

I had preaclampsia with my first child, it sucked, that mag. they put you on is horrible.. but on the bright side they induse your pregnancy and you don't have to be pregnant as long.. I don't know about you but being pregnant in the summer is not fun!!

question: i'm 35 weeks pregnant and have been seeing flashes of light a few times a day, all I can find on google is eye disorders, I think this is an oxygen thing. I take deep breaths until they go away. It happens almost everytime I twist to reverse the car. You know they say not to lay on your back because it cuts off oxygen but I wonder if my babe is postioned to hit that vital something when I am sitting and twist, cause it happens when I'm giving my girls a bath. Then again, it happens occasionaly for no reason at times it seems. Could this be happening because at night I often wake up and find myself lying flat on my back. Maybe a lingering effect of lacking oxygen at night. Anyone?
title: seeing flashes, 35 weeks pregnant
